alert.note: Alert for Central Panhandle Mountains (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 24 at 4:10PM MST until November 26 at 8:00AM MST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...LIGHT TO MODERATE SNOW TO IMPACT NORTH IDAHO AND TRAVEL ACROSS LOOKOUT PASS FRIDAY EVENING AND NIGHT... .It will be a relatively mild afternoon across North Idaho but cooler temperatures will arrive with increasing precipitaiton Friday evening and night. Road conditions across Lookout pass and portions of the Central Panhandle Mountains could change rapidly around or shortly after dark. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM FRIDAY TO 7 AM PST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations at Lookout Pass of 3 to 6 inches. Valley accumulations between 1 and 3 inches. * WHERE...Osburn, Lookout Pass, Dobson Pass, Fernwood, Fourth Of July Pass, Kellogg, Wallace, St. Maries, Mullan, and Pinehurst. * WHEN...From 4 PM Friday to 7 AM PST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Winter travel conditions could impact the Friday evening commute, especially across Lookout Pass. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Be cautious of changing road conditions Friday night as temperatures fall below freezing.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
